SENT.plain: Klippel-Trénaunay syndrome is a rare congenital vascular disorder characterized by varicose veins, hypertrophy of the soft tissues and bones, and hemangiomas
Although colorectal angiomatosis is uncommon, this association can lead to life-threatening complications because of acute or chronic bleeding
We report a patient with Klippel-Trénaunay syndrome who presented with transfusion-dependent anemia secondary to chronic rectal bleeding
Endoscopy and image studies revealed venous angiomata involving the rectum and distal sigmoid colon
We performed a laparoscopic ultralow anterior resection with intersphincteric dissection, obtaining good results
After a follow-up of 20 months the patient did not present hematochezia and maintained fecal continence
